intro: Anchusa strigosa subsp. tonsa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bugloss, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, narrow leaves and spikes of blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in Mediterranean climates and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Anchusa strigosa subsp. tonsa is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
